words.definition: Charity is an act of giving help, usually money, to those who need it.
words.example: Thanks to his friends’ charity, he had enough money to pay the rent.

words.definition: Commerce is the activity of buying and selling things.
words.example: The new shopping mall increased the commerce in that section of town.

words.definition: To condemn someone means to give them a specific punishment.
words.example: The judge condemned the criminal to five years in prison.

words.definition: If something is cozy, then it is comfortable, warm, and relaxing.
words.example: The thick blanket made the bed very cozy.

words.definition: To deplete an amount of something means to use up a lot of it.
words.example: The big harvest depleted the soil of its nutrients.

words.definition: An economy is the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used.
words.example: The country’s economy is growing very slowly.

words.definition: An empire is a large group of countries or states ruled by a single leader.
words.example: The Roman Empire was one of the largest in history.

words.definition: Goods are items that are bought and sold.
words.example: The store sells many different types of goods.

words.definition: To heed something means to pay attention to it and follow it.
words.example: Heed my advice and don’t go out in the storm.

words.definition: To hitchhike is to travel by asking for rides from passing vehicles.
words.example: He decided to hitchhike across the country.

words.definition: To mock someone is to tease them or make fun of them.
words.example: The other children mocked him because of his glasses.

words.definition: When someone is neutral, they do not support either side in an argument.
words.example: The judge must remain neutral during the trial.

words.definition: To persecute someone is to treat them badly because of their race or beliefs.
words.example: The group was persecuted for their religious beliefs.

words.definition: Pity is a feeling of sadness for someone who is in trouble.
words.example: I felt a lot of pity for the homeless man.

words.definition: To reduce something means to make it smaller in size or amount.
words.example: The company wants to reduce its expenses.

words.definition: A scribe is a person whose job was to copy documents in the past.
words.example: The scribe carefully wrote the king’s decree on the scroll.

words.definition: Temper is the way you feel or behave, especially when you are angry.
words.example: He has a very short temper and gets angry easily.

words.definition: A throne is a special chair used by a king or queen.
words.example: The king sat on his throne and addressed his people.

words.definition: Unity is the state of being joined together as a whole.
words.example: The people showed unity in their fight against the invaders.

words.definition: A victor is the person who wins a competition or battle.
words.example: The victor of the race received a gold medal.
